title: What were the discoveries and improvements made by Donato in the practice of magnetism?
first_phrase: In the final 200 tokens, the text discusses the role of Donato in the practice of magnetism. Donato was born in Liège in 1845 and introduced significant improvements in the practice of magnetism, including provoking cataleptic states through sudden noises on awake or sleeping subjects. He was a successful magnetizer and his demonstrations were recognized by many scientists and medical professionals. The text presents a summary of the improvements that Donato has introduced, including the production of normal sleep during somnambulism, the ability to wake subjects by leaving partial contractions, and the cessation of menstruation during somnambulism. The text also highlights that although some doctors were initially skeptical, many have come to recognize that the simple magnetizers were the first to observe the physiological and psychological effects of magnetism.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the scientific method of Donato and his discoveries remain a significant contribution to the study of magnétisme. His legacy includes a rational and conclusive method of experimentation, orderly presentation of facts, and the practical applications of suggestion in healthcare. While some may have stolen his work, his methods remain powerful tools in the hands of those who seek to positively impact society. Donato believed in collaboration between doctors and magnétiseurs, and perhaps one day, science will reveal the true potential of this fascinating field.
